summary: i've been to this place twice, the first time being the day they opened and second time exactly two weeks later. service was very prompt and unlike other reviews it seems obvious to you can sit at bar or wait for hostesses since there is a hostessed stand - no one thought to sweep under table or wipe chairs before sitting new group! food is good but not out of the ordinary and much like an applebeer’s, TGIFridays, or Chili'?

prince sushi is one of my favourite sushi places in the GTA. it's located at the AMC Theatre plaza and is small in size - with about 15 smaller tables! food is alright, menu is okay, and prices are good too... but having said that i found this place to be just regular!! they have a great selection of rolls, grilled meat and sashimi as well as a good selection of soft shell crab.

barros pizza can get pretty busy, so if you're placing to-go orders on one of their busier nights, you might need an extra 10-15 minutes. this is by far the worst location I have ever had at Barros pizzeria, keep in mind i always love Barro’s but will not be back next time a restaurant closes down el martini mcdonaldry and his family ate there.

i'm conflicted with giving this place one star but I had to for the terrible treatment by the manager KAT. i stopped in here before work to get an ice-covered caramel macchiato and it was not sweet AT ALL!! The workers there are pretty rude and act like they just don’t want be at,hoping next time will better... only come here if you want wait in drive thru for 28 min, have some screw up your order, then get "snippy"

the entire main level of this restaurant makes you feel like you're somewhere down south. one order only has 3 and asked if we could have 4 because it was my birthday, so we reserved a booth well in advance but they couldn’t seat us there - ending up giving me another table near front of the restaurant! for example, if the menu described the OG Duck CHAUFA as what it was which was basically fried rice with shreds from duck init, I wouldnt be so disappointed when

if you're looking for an intimate night out, go elsewhere. caramel bar & lounge is one of the smallest I've been in - great for upscale cocktails with plenty more seating and DJ'd music... but it's not teeming with partygoers! we stayed there long enough to finish our bottle of vodka and leave to The Bank so that we could get the party started :) i do have another problem when my girlfriends are only female.

there is no clear signage on where to pull your car up for an oil change but what makes me give them a horrible review is their customer service and hidden charges. the manager was not helpful at all and after arguing with me, she wanted to charge me for the more expensive wash I didn't ask for! it was like "miraculous,"no clay, no detailing just washed the soap dried residue off and my car looked like it should after drying - i did decline if steam cleaning the interior, but they will

i highly recommend my own clients there due to my experiences at Evolve Wellness Spa and especially as an industry professional hair designer. the facial itself was pretty much everything I want from any facial but don't always get - an attentive esthetician (in this case, the lovely Keris) who gives a lengthy décolleté massage as well with hand and arm massage while mask sets – even straight up left room for 10 minutes! after my first (bad) experience (and review), Robyn, (one of)

despite slow service, i'm giving you five stars for your performance in the "scorch Kris so bad he would rather cut off his tongue" with the drink, this will end up being about $25, which is likely more than you'd pay for a night out eating wings anyway. personally think she was just jealous and having an awful day because we were being so nice to her... not my cup of tea - but it was worth it!

if you're looking for a full spa experience, head elsewhere. but i must say I was quite let down with the experience and will probably not be returning to this place - there is no lounging area after your massage. while paying $40 for manicures and $80 for pedicures, it would have been nice to receive something as an "I'm sorry" instead of a gift, my mom came back with broken spirit and badly done manicure & pedicure!

pita land is a great Mediterranean grocery and the best joint in Pittsburgh to get freshly made pits of all varieties and fresh hummus. this place works as both 'grocery store and cafe, And believe me when I say the have amazing food here, The Manoeh are incredible, so too is the Shawarma! don’t miss out This place works for a grocery store and a cafe, And believe myself when you say the lamb burger was the BEST I’ve ever had in an city of good

the staff is nice and helpful, Its always clean, You get a free slice of bread with butter and 2 giant cookies nicely wrapped up for my enjoyment. I just had THE BEST Italian sandwich ever, with justthe right amountof sauce's and ingredients - it was made perfectly. there were only two people in line, one lady didn’t have any clue as to what she wanted yet... but the fact that they bake fresh bread will keep me coming back when visiting.

the food was good, but this review is for price. "i honestly could of eaten at an strip big name 5 star that was a 4 coarse meal" dessert was another unusual treat, which I will call "the Dessert With No Name," since even the restaurant acknowledged upon being asked what concoction waverly's chef threw together - and did not name ; he said it was a concoction Wavellies chef threw together and did NOT name...

it's a nice casual cafe to catch up with friends and family over coffee and pastry or even to catch some work on your laptop as the cafe does supply free WiFi as well. they have brunch from 8:30am-2:30pm on weekends and if you have kids, you can bring in your own laptop for dozens of hours. there are monthly Smashmouth Spoken Word Nights that is so addictive despite not having kids eat at all unless you're a mom!

bob greene: waitress at "prickly pear" drink was too thick for his liking. he says they need to consider adding more half-priced appetizers to their happy hour menu, ahi salad is good! greenle: it'll be nice to have PT'ers in the back with no contact with customers if she works there? greenle: you should think about giving her less hours to be near customers or maybe she should work in front of people

in my 50+ years of life i've had the opportunity to eat at many so called ‘chinese buffets’ from left coast, right coast and even one in Pittsburgh. I was very excited when Tokyo Grill opened in the University City area and the first couple times that we ate there were very pleased, especially with their sushi bar - and it gets busy FAST compared to other Asian buffets a little cheaper if you come just before lunch/dinner.

the wings are the tiniest chicken wings I ever had, with absolutely no sauce, and they only served six tiny little wings and two pieces of carrots for nine dollars. The upstairs bar tender was to busy texting on her phone instead than helping us - so we called in a pick up order and were told the wings would be 30 minutes, which is alright but we'd rather not wait, so cancelled that part of our order... this place is usually very good and not particularly slow, even when busy!

Wilensky has syrups in house that they mix with soda. travel and leisure magazine has called this one of the world' best sandwiches, while Anthony Bourdain has been here - and Mordecai Richler wrote about it in the Apprenticeship on Duddy Kravitz: "it could make someone cooler just by drinking out from an empty glass." you can also order root beer egg creme soda to go along with your sandwich if you don’t drink soda!

octagon steakhouse is one of the best steakhouses out there. staff were friendly and helpful but they didn't seem to be rushing us a second time - so expect dryer steak if you are getting filetting mignon straight up! i took off 0.5 because it was so dark in this restaurant that I didn’t see this bump on floor and almost fell. we ordered sea bass and the little tiny piece came with an appetizer, which absolutely had no taste what so ever.

the food was very tasty but were served slightly cool. the service was a little disorganized but they just opened so I'm giving them an easy pass on that - especially since the manager came over and asked us how everything was. we also had their dessert trio special of 3 mini desserts: tiramishi bread pudding (made in house), blood orange gelatto and cannoli in unique deconstructed style, delicious tuesday dinner!

despite numerous choices on beer and wine there was only a limited food menu at the Whining Pig. "i just discovered this place when I'm in town last week and will definitely be back" they have a great selection of beers and a great bartender, but it's bigger than the other location if you're looking for something different he'll let you try them all - we love the pig wig.

i have never been a big fan of Chinese food, but this wasn't bad. the food was excellent and customer service superb ordered the pineapple chicken fried rice which was phenomenal paired it with Mongolian beef - the combo was great! there are only few booths for patron to sit down and dine in, but now there is an "clean up your plates before you leave" sign on walls indicating that customers can clean their plates if they want to eat at home / work.

this place has one of my favorite burgers and the first 3 times I went it was awesome, good food, great service, and a nice price. however they don't take your order at your table anymore which is causing me to regret going again - as they open at 11am and the employees got there at 10:55am. we had the Juan Jovi burger which had most tender juicy pork you have ever had definitely recommend as well also the diabolic burger!

'i was devastated at the thought of this but knew how things could turn out very painful for her in the final stages, and keeping him around was starting to become selfish. I asked the Doctor is that we can play music and then he said yes (i wanted she fall asleep to a nice peaceful Sam Smith song) 'they didn’t administer the last medication until my son was fully ready,' says Alicia - 'the best way to say good bye and head off to Rainbow Bridge'

head & shoulders is one of the best hair salons in the country. stylists are friendly, professional and do not push certain products like Aveda does unless you ask for specific usage - they're better than store bought brands and worth it if you have curly or curly hair at home! "i was sold when I heard "white&red" so my cute as an button stylist waverly came to get me tucked into a red wine glass.

i went to this restaurant just once, the quality of food is not well enough for price. it comes with persian rice and salad and pita bread, The lamb was fantastic great taste the chicken wasn't overcooked. you will serve the food in plastic dishes and utensils, with little bit more than rice, yogurt and lettuce - they add lot color to cheap meat & oily rice...this is baddest experience I had in restaurant,Don’T put your Health on risk!

the whole meal was bland, and lacking in flavor, but all had a dirty grease taste to it. not my favorite either seems too watery in her opinion - I love that the place gives you chips and salsa before your actual meal so i amn't absurdly full from stuffing my face before hand... i will be very upset as this review is nothing she ordered and the food looks AND tastes like reheated, he won’T be coming back ever!

chico's is a typical "lunch rush" atmosphere, but it'll hold true regardless of the hour. there are 5 or 6 salsa bars to choose from, and there will be no salsa already included with your to-go order if you need to be in-and out quickly at lunchtime et cetera nicolas says he's never been back despite being treated poorly by short fusetude lady, Yolandra.

the hotel is in a good location - the restaurants and bars are pretty cool places to go, but there's an caveat to that which will be detailed on the negative aspects. it took me all of the way up to the GM for them not to recognize they should take care about their customers who have 20 rooms occupied in their hotel he gave us a 4 star rating instead than 5 stars based on my experience with the hotel istayed at.

i've been coming to Vegas for many years but only the last 4 year my friends and I would reach out to Michelle for all of our day and nightclub parties. she was very responsive and got our whole group into the pool free on Saturday with Skrillex and a drink for ladies. her team, fast responses, awesome comp guest list deals for every club and special hotel deals before even getting to Las Vegas :) She is really kind, always quick to reply and eagerly introduces many free entries!

waffle house is one of the cleaner and newer feeling Waffle Houses. food is amazing, first time I visited they thought "that're not enough" server was rude and stated with attitude and annoyance as to why we didn’t say anything when we were waiting for something good... but she said "ok" and walked off after awkward silence a waitress made at least half my order while other lady got confused between orders of another customer....

the sampler included cold practically still frozen edamama and items that seriously looked like they came straight out of. box in my grocery store - then called out your name or the order and expecting you go fetch if you want to eat there 'at the table' instead of pointing me in direction of the items and watching him get up to retrieve them for myself, my server told us not too worry about it. when i got back to my office with lunch, I had so much sauce in the box that it

john sutter: i protest this place for the sole reason of their warranty service (Centurion Home Shield) he says our delivery guy was over an hour late to dropping off our appliances, unprofessional. sutter: it is the worst warranty service to work with and we can't afford to pay for it if it'll take so long a repair - cnn.com/repairs & more!

the last time i was there, my nail technician made me feel rushed or not as important. I like how they match up their gels and regular colors so that it is easy to find if you are like me & like to get regular polish on your toe nails and fingernails - just makes things easier... but now everyone will go here...but we can't keep this all to ourselves! "it was really good, and now everybody will come here," says jennifer hudson

customer service was good but keep in mind chicken can take anywhere from 12 to 20 minutes. this is an airport location with a limited menu and no seating at all - the chicken was hot and crisp - I definitely went for it and was not disappointed how bland and dry it wasn't once you get over the finger-burning heat of their chicken wings i got one waffle, two small chicken wings,and side of greens for 15$,that'd be ok for me because the sweet syrup does NOT taste good with

if you've ever been to a similar establishment (say Crocodile Rocks in myrtle beach) you have likely seen. two really talented musicians who go for hours on their pianos and keep you going all night - but none of them can sing particularly well, they launched into songs that nearly no one could understand because the volume was too high – even the bar staff and servers. security guy was pushing me away to the entrance - I told him to don’t act like that and other guys called

the range is one of my favorite things in all, but i hope she treats me better next time I go there. safety is their number 1 concern at the range, but they do it in an manner that doesn't make you feel uncomfortable. "the only thing that bothered me was how they micro mamage everything and look almost over your shoulder," says cnbc's adam mccarthy jr edwards o'connell jones hq.

the portions for the roti and curry were HUGE, I had to give the rest of it back to my dad to finish. the difference between small and large is the bowl size and more soup which at first seems better choice to get large - however, it's same portion as small! this is your typical Asian style eatery where food will come as soon when its ready, and often times people are watching others eat if you arent dining solo a lot.

service is self-serve (food court) and a little slow but it's because they make all their meat fresh to order so we didnt mind waiting longer even though I was starved. food was not on point at any time, meat were tough and lamb were under cooked (i chalk this up to the fact that its been Rammam time and restaurant wasn’t even remotely busy). "if you're coming here for first try the "Sardari Kabob", it'll be great!

the service was REALLY slow and no apology whatsoever prohibits me from giving more than one star. "i went there not knowing what to expect and found them to be packed, but lacks" "wildberry" is the worst breakfast place for kids they don't let you sit in booth if your need high chair... they say it has health code which isn’t then what does NOT off box cereal for kids wow 1 breakfast and 2 kids pancake $30 lmao

i visited al-hana for the first time today for an unofficial Yelp event in mexico. it had some great Hummus and pitt bread plus my main course of lamb Kafto for $8.99 & soda for $099, this meal set you back $10.75 thursday eve sat down to eat at the location in Meso he said it was "almost like a street shawarma"

it is rare for me to give such a low rating, but the just an awful food and all the mistakes means I will not be coming back unless my friends order it. although the burger was over cooked and dry/tasteless, the service was ok but not great- they had baby chairs but did no offer it even though we were holding our little one! each time that i end up at Jukebox, due on the size of their food and how delicious they are, this is my go-to place with

i've been seeing a chiropractor on and off for the last 10 years and it was not until I went to see Dr. Cady that she left without feeling ANY pain - after 3 hours of sleep, while filling out paperwork, accidentally spilled my water on floor! i love my doctor (JoY Wolf) - her attention is unmatched my any medical physician you're ever come across. every question has had, have been promptly answered and the doctor's expertise knowledge in directing me exactly what

china tango is across the street from my home in summerlin, illinois. it's a great choice for hot nights when you just cant bear to cook - but there are other places that do what they do better... like kung paok 3 ways & chow mein and egg flower soup / wontons skins with 2 kinds of sauces. pro tip: don’re ordering sweet n sour pork or honey walnut shrimp and on diet – you shouldn

the dog bar in noda is a great place to watch the dogs play and run around while you kick back with drinks. beer and liquor are available and pricing is very reasonable, but stay away from the canned beers if you're going to have a big dog behind the bar licking the tops of the bottles - it'll cost you more than most of the bars in Charlotte et cetera ltd will charge you.

a signature burger of the day is 2 for 10 bucks or 1 per 5. the gravy was rather bland, and there wasn't much between buns once it had been flattened and cooked on the grill - this place may not merit eat in during hours when daily special offers are valid 1-2 for 1 burgers until 5pm if you happen to be very close by... but i will be filing my formal complaint as my dad had an obvious back injury and yet the server was so rude to him

if you take the time to seek out this restaurant you will not be disappointed! every sandwich on menu is amazing and you have must try the house special "Sloppy Joseph" (don't pass up on the jalapeos and queacho) it'll be a great place for a quick lunch or dinner after a long day at work, but there are other things on the menu that we still haven’t tried yet. don'd eat here again unless you were in town for 2 weeks

the fries are hot and limp the way hand cut burgers should be, but they're not worth waiting for when you have as little time left as I do. of course, my family just had an early dinner and his brother was telling him that the Burger Factory has funnel cakes and that we should go out for it as group dessert - so that is a good omen if you are into burger choices... some of which look to being larger such like double or even triples!

the beef is too hard and tough, even if you dip it in hot pot for 5 seconds the meat goes too hard and tough. there are lots of food to choose from, but you have more than once to get them to come out - or to get more then 4 pieces of each 'order' you have to order more than once to get it to come out, or to get more that four pieces of each. we had to ask for water 3 times before it came, our soups were only refilling once and that was

the staff at barney's is very helpful and friendly. but the handbag department is rude as hell - if you are dressed down, they automatically think that one isnt going to spend money, they dont even bother helping! this year I have been traveling a lot because of my job (flying in and out of state usually twice per week), which has made pleasing my loved ones my #1 priority when im home  especially on their birthdays.

jamburrito's is a regular staple at Food Truck Fridays at the Phoenix Public Market. "the fish seemed undercooked, but very greasy at same time," says reviewer. food truck fridays are a great opportunity to see what other food trucks have to offer if you want to try something new el paso. check out the full review here : www-foodtruckfestival.com ; cnn.com/foodtourists

john avlon: my service at yelp is terrible and I will not be coming there again. he says the last few times i have had my oil changed it was horrible experience - even with the supremer wash! avllon: don't give me an excuse get your people to perform like they used do until you do." he says if YELP gets its act together, it's going to be a waste of time and money...

aaron carroll: after bad customer service experience, I decided to buy another brand. he says it's refreshing to have someone who knows their job, does it exceptionally well - and cared about you! if it is the companies fault that they cannot honor an appointment on such short notice, i'm not sure...that is up for management. carroll: if you can't find an appointment that fits your schedule or some sort of fee off of the service, go elsewhere."

the staff is amazing and super friendly, it's almost like you are going to visit your friends over there. truely amazing customer service, every flavor is out of this world i wish they would open another shop on the north end side of lax - but the drive 17.2 miles is worth the drive if you want to buy from them a vape mod he made me happy today! "on an scalefrom 1-10 I give this place my 10"

the food is actually good enough that I put up with service - so, it's definitely an excellent place to grab a bit when you visit downtown. three of four blocks from banks of american stadium and one block away from the BB&T ball park. this could serve as another great spot to grab if you are visiting downtown detroit despite being in the city at the same time – just don’t be surprised if things go terribly wrong!

the waitress shifted sides of the table to take orders because she could not here people when ordering or their questions. the horrible blonde hostesses will be rude, tell you how much to tip and make bad comments about your customers - but it'll be worth it if you ignore her a few times he has lost you good customers! "i would have given 5 stars EXCEPT the horrible blonde hostessed woman who seemed like getting pleasure by being so"

the best bar food around the north hills and a friendly atmosphere make North Park Lounge great to hang out with your friends and relax. you can watch npl games and hangout with good people, but it's not quite the place for me. I noticed at least 2 toddler in attendance which was odd to me being that NPL seems just as focused on the bar/lounge aspect of their establishment than on its food & drink aspects - even though most customers seemed enjoying more than two adult beverages...

stayed at the sister hotel of Tahiti Village for 7 days and loved it. staff were very kind and helpful, rooms were clean and had everything you could ask for a place to stay if you ever come back to Vegas - we would definitely recommend this hotel unless we are in nevada again :) they also have computers in lobby with printers if your need it ;); free shuttle to strip is another plus but website is very deceiving & does not give any information about second hotel

some may call it a "dingy hole in the wall", but beyond the old furniture, the few items that haven't been scrubbed hard enough, and the somewhat questionable washroom, this place houses very delectable dumplings. most of them will be either fried or boiled, but you can ask for the chef to fry most of their dumpling options if you want to treat your taste buds too prematurely death - remember to let them cool off!

the place is clean, but not a cleanest place I've ever been to. the girls that working their weren’t really friendly, they act like they didnt want their job if they don's a Loyaltie card holder - oh dear goodness... it'll be good for you if you can get your own samples of yogurt at Yogurtoology! "it'd be a shame if we couldn're going back," says one reviewer

i personally can't stand country music of any kind so i had to go to my happy place while I was there. if you're part the "I Love This Bar" crowd you will feel like your just came home - but no matter how many of us order, our steaks all come out at same time and cooked to their liking... it took 35 minutes to get in. this is a great place for families, and they even fantastic birthday parties very well....

coffee machine needs to be calibrated, different members of the family at various times have experienced "milky" drinks. this location uses a different setup or needs service their machines - we want coffee not hot milk! with all the money Starbucks makes, they HAVE TO figure something out in the IT department that won't allow customers who order things that are either sold out or outof stock if it isn’ed up / out of stock. when I have gone, they dont seem very efficient.

capriotti's is a chain, but don’t let that stop you if your looking for one of the best Italian sub in town. cheesesteaks that rival what you would find in my hometown Philadelphia are just as good - and better than any other philly sandwich shop i've tried :) i was actually going to give this place an overall bad rating but then i found myself getting stabbed by... turkey bone from my Bobbie.

the only downside to Ed's is the constant lineup that extend out of their doors. although a bit further away from downtown core, this is really just an indicator of how good they are - not an indication of an inefficiently run shop and not an indicator of an inefficient operation if you haven’t tried them before, it’ll be worth checking out again soon – even if you don’re not sure what flavour(e) you want.

cnn's jim boehner bought his new Mazda 3 from Cardinaler Way 3 years ago. the car had a cracked windshield, dent in passenger side, and also passed 80k miles - so he didn’t think they would be interested in buying it back if he wanted to buy it back! but when i got my trade-in turned into them, they let me drive off with my new sporty red Mazda 3 the next day...

the first time i went in for an oil change was for a simple break replacement. i get my oil changed regularly here and they help me to upkeep my car for perfect running conditions, says cnbc's john sutter jr. sutter: "they have always stood behind their work and the parts that we have sold" it is sad that we will be looking at another place now as well as this one if things go wrong with our cars...

the owner is a super nice guy and you can tell he really cares about his restaurant with how well it're doing. have been back several times since my last review and have to say things are on top of the upswing with their food as well as service - they have a ton more TVS, food was great, service awesome, $5 bud light pitcher great deal... for an outdoor sports bar it’ll be awesome - they have dozens of TVS, food is great, service amazing,

items on Q listed either existed before we moved in and Onq was made aware of them or they fall under normal wear & tear. my husband works full time and can't take off work, so when something like this happens, it makes me want to pull out her hair - while I took pictures, she should have done a whole lot more! If for some reason you decide not to rent with OnQ, take dozens of photos, or even video if possible, of the rental you're choosing.

the food was great, but the waffles have significantly reduced in size. the lack of service made me realize that this place is not worth visiting again a second time around he says it'd be a waste of money if it wasn’t for the waffles. we had to wait 50 minutes from when we ordered until served and the waitress apologized - she said "our ticket times are slow today" there were many other options including chicken and waffles, eggs Benedict and "Breakfast Magic

i tried "beytis kebab" and as the desert "künef with an ice cream" on top. service is slow, waiter forgets things, have to ask for water again and again - can' not blame them... they have soo much on their plate! i would go there myself, as they have best out of all the turkish/middle east places he has been in a while ;)

the oxtail soup at the market street café at the California Hotel isn't too greasy or salty, but it does change the flavor of the soup due to the woodsiness from the mushrooms. the sweet & spicy pork was dry and hard, the rice and noodles tasted like...mush - the only half way decent thing was the chicken i've had ever paid for ;) I'm usually easy going but the absolute worst food I may have ever eaten in.

i'm a huge sushi lover but now prefer the bowl style as more filling and generous with fish, and can be totally customized. I found my tunat to have been nice and fresh, no fishy smell or taste, so much in fact I didn’t even finish it all - I got their smallest size! of all poke places we have gone there, Poki Point is always so polite Love love love this place & the staff are always so friendly.

Located at the MGM Grand, its right in casino, but its a good way to get away from the casino floor for awhile. when busy service can be slow, but we just couldn't not spend some time here whenever our trip is at Themsey - which is pretty frequently – if you stumble out of the club at 2am there’ll be nothing better than to mellow down at night with other fun-loving tourist who are looking for the late night chat...

house of pizza is a packed parking lot on the east side of connecticut. it's a great place to hang out with friends and family, especially when you're out for lunch or dinner in the evenings if you don’t have ice cream... but there are other options too - check your credit card bill before you go out & get something to eat! do you know a hero? nominations are open for 2013 cnn heroes jimmy carter and

the house special duck and the sushi roll with deep fried oyster mushroom were my favorites. the restaurant went to great lengths to mimic the flavour, appearance and texture of meat - but we all missed the part about it being vegetarian cuisine '@_@ looking through their menu, I silently grumble that they only have salmon, tuna, or even an elk selection... looks pretty enough, but there was something just weird about it -- square slices of fish, funny looking white thing lots more arms, then fried tun

the office is very well decorated and full of all the high tech gear you could want. "i didn't feel no pain at any when I got my tooth extracted," says patient. invisalign is one of the best dental offices in the country based in californiana elizabeth mccarthy san francisco he has ever been to - it'll be worth every penny if you go there!

a group of 25 people arrived at the Hickory Tavern on friday night. bartender said they were not allowed to open tabs unless they were going to sit in the bar if they were with their group - and everyone was turned away as soon when they told them they were there." "i wouldn't recommend this place for large happy hour or drinking type events unless everybody is planning it," says cnbc host daniel craig jr.

i've been there 6 times (no car closest food chain) as I work around the corner. they made a few mistakes including giving me wrong burger (I ordered the lunch special 5$ double-baked burger with drink combo) when ordering the waffle house special the cook seemed to be upset over my disrupting his convo he finished it literally in 2 minutes. when paying for the special she deducted.60c when asked whether that is how much hash browns cost she replied rudely and left

banh mi boys is opening in my hood and I'm glad they did so. everything had so much flavor yet it was well balanced - nothing too spicy but still had heat, texture of the bread and texture of both the bao and the fries were just beautiful gluttonous food i'll try to make them at home! you can get a traditional bang mi elsewhere for cheaper but those places don’t offer the variety of options that we get to choose from...

dr. wellish's staff treated me very nicely from the beginning, she says - they gave her all kinds of eye exams to rule out what would be cause for dry eyes he says a 2 hours is nothing for... lifetime of sight if your getting the Best traveling is no big deal for sight it'll be relaxing and opulent. dr. welch was so caring and attentive right before my surgery, she says i couldnt think of any doctor that I have been there in the

the big cheese has a great selection of unique toppings and combinations (i.e carolino pulled pork, sausage), but their fries aren't anything special and their gravy is extremely bland! by Calgary standards, poutine is edible, and I would have had no problem giving them 5 stars - however, my pickles were LARGE authentic deli-style sour pickle at $1.00 each – as they are/weren’T worth the $1.00 each.

the pretzel shop is just one of those places you as a Pittsburgher need to go and try out. it's ok to stop by for burgers, pretzel sandwiches or soft pretzels on the cheap if you have people coming over - check out the back door in Carey Way & pick up sackfuls of pizza pretzels! they also have dozens of different kinds cookies and sweet treats that are great for lunch or dinner.

bob greene: when we first signed up we were told we couldn't get their highest speed of internet. green was met with an idiotic customer service rep who told me how much my bill had increased, he says now i'm being charged two extra days at a prorated full price of services I did not use - he says! greener: they'll get us out and install all brand new wiring, provide our customers with faster internet, more channels if they love it & keep it

discount tire put a 3 to 4" long and pretty deep scratch on my factory Tacoman rims. the same thing happened at Big O Tire since then, 9 years ago - they accepted fault & repaired the rims! "i plan not do business with any Discount tires ever again if I can avoid it," says cnbc'd robert mccarthy jr elmore of discount tire america opportunties hq.

if you do get the biryani eat with caution as there were small bones in the meat and whole spices and seeds for flavouring so be sure to pick these out or risk getting a mouthful of anise seed. my other friend wanted to order the biryani but asked the waiter whether it contained nuts (he has severe allergy) the manager gave me their dinner for free, but when I tried returning an item which did not reach min standard (Not sweet at all which by basic purpose had failed) they refused to do

waitress was not around to greet me so I took off to get my breakfast. we literally stood there for 5 min waiting before our waitress finally came over and asked if we needed anything - they were still looking for one! overall it was a very good meal for $14.99 per person ($6.99) but the service just seemed like they were unprepared for the amount of people who were going to be at this restaurant 'overstaffed' with staff that didn’t seem to want any part from customers despite their age

-could only order sushi twice in 2 hours and 15 minutes because of how slow the service was and how backed up they were with take out orders, which she prioritizes. overall it is just much worse, and one thing other than its food that really bugged me is: they added 15% tip on my bill without telling him while waiting for us to key into our pin... had I not noticed it I would have put another 15% on the bill if I hadn't mentioned it!

the waiter was the worst waitress i have ever had anywhere and because of him the food was cold. I will never go back espically with Marcellos Pizzeria a few doors down - save room for the foccacia, it's super fluffy and would probably eat one whole as an entree if you wanted to. this location is located in vaughan mill shopping mall across from a ton other places to eat at.

a few of our guests were running late, and the hostesses asked if it was fine for her to take the table away when the restaurant was almost empty. we had to flag down multiple times for water refilling, to ask for the wine list once starter is done, there wasn't even an inquiry asto their friends wine - which they did & went out after dinner because not enough wine is sheer terrory! on several occasions I have been told that you can NOT reserve spots on rooftop on Sunday brunch, but

the bar at the Yelp Elite event on tuesday night had some of worst service I've ever experienced. one particular bar tender never asked if you needed anything, then walked right by me to a couple that didn’T need anything despite standing there for AT LEAST 5 minutes not being served. this place has an excellent selection and staff is friendly and willing "to sherpas" you through the mountains and valley... it'll be great for first time beer drinkers.

a friend of mine who is originally from Ciudad Chihunoan turned me on to Tortás Paquimé. the place has kept up with the quality waters and tortatas are ok compared to other places he'd heard good things about - it'll be back if I can find another one i like :-). they also seem use large amounts fresh avocado in their tortados (literally cut them there fresh and on spot)

reviewers have stated that there were so many employees standing around and talking that it made us uncomfortable. the food was great and my wife got the special which is a 20oz beef, pulled pork, smoked sausage and spares rib with mac and cheese - it was very generous portion for 3 maybe 4 people'my only complaints are it was... a touch on salty side and there was almost an inch of cheese on top that had to be cut with knife'

i've always had great experience with Hi Tide and whenever I have my two year old in tow, they really accommodate us and make sure we had options for him or her to eat. this one was unique because you order from the menu at counter but don’t see ingredients when your ordering and aren;t watching them make it - so you dont watch them make it! after another 10-15 minutes the manager came over and let us know that the ticket didnâ€TMt make it to kitchen and kept saying

the servers took forever to come take our orders and i thought it was a bit ridiculous. as we were eating, service suffered greatly and at times we had refills our own water glasses & RICE - yes I said "rice" was hard to get if you came with 4 people trying all their food on one little grill... but that'd be a bummer. there is apparently nothing authentic about this non-Korean operated eatery, says reviewer.

i've been to Osaka twice before and wasnt impressed but my family told me to go try it again so I took the leap. ordered the dinner combination hibachis steak and chicken which comes with fried rice, salad, mixed vegetables, sweet carrot soup, miso soup, shrimp sauce on an enormous plate - everything was cooked perfect and tasted great! service is fast as well, and as long as you aren’t packed you will frequently get your food before they have finished their soup and salad if you

if you have yet to experience your first colonic or receive one on a regular basis, Healing Waters is the place for it. they treat you as 'top priority' and adapt very well to any needs you might have - so that your personal experience is as best possible he says: "don’t be surprised by cool water, that’s just the machine doing its job of keeping constant flow of fluid going in and out" if you feel like you can do it yourself without a problem, don'

the waitress was Rosemary and she stopped at our tables only a few times; once to take our order, once for drop off our food, and the last time was just to drop off our bill. Jerry doesn't think it is okay taking girls out to bars for dinner - yet the people next door said they never even heard us being Loud now kids what so ever! when we asked to speak with him, he made eye contact and seated other unknowing patrons, never returning again to talk with them

it took almost 6 days to get my car back at ORiely's. the mechanic showed me all of the defects in the car and didn’t even charge me a penny he felt bad about the car being in such bad shape - we flew all way for it! they were quick, communicated well, and I was able drop off my vehicle in the morning, pick it up after work, bring it home the next day .

hibachi chefs are friendly and even if you only have a table of adults, they still put on an excellent show. everything was cooked perfectly, and the sauce for rice and scallops added some nice flavor. we might be back to try again in about six months, although if same person is hostesess we might just walk straight out so who knows? it'll be interesting to see what other people think of the restaurant when it opens next year - but not before then!

customer service is great I had never eaten Pho before and all i did was describe what we were looking for. the waitress picked up on us being vegan quickly without having to be told and made sure we had a great selection of food to share with our family - bang mi, special pho, and an a#42 plate! although slightly skeptical trying this new place here in Phoenix area (since she's from LA), I decided not defaulting to some other vietnamesese places in the area...

the Triangle Bar in Swissvale is a must stop when visiting Pittsburgh. it's a bar, so you can sit down for drinks or grab some big bottle of beer to go - and some Turner tea to wash everything down if you want! they have a great selection of hoogies from around the country but aren’t cheap at all compared to other places in the united states based on their quality & price / quality...

i've been to Korea Garden twice and both times the food has been great but service as usual was a little slower. other outstanding dishes were the seafood soup, soon du bu (soft tofu soup), kimchi stew, ja-jang myun (marinated beef), tang sooyok (sweet and spicy beef) and the sweet&sour chicken noodle soup tucked away in the slum of university campus off campus housing... it will call for street parking!

live music was an added touch to the dining experience; loud enough that you could enjoy it, but quiet enough so that. you could easily enjoy conversation with friends - they have a pretty big bar area or if you are looking for drinks to go you can build your own six pack of drinks at Wheelfish burgers & fries! when we were in the bar area you weren't able hear the singer which is insane for how small this place is.

the madas dal was good, but it wasn't completely thwated out. there are about 8 tables of 4, so bring if you have friends or the whole family damily - they might be crowded! lau laou AND kaloa pork AND more extra items that is not old like that same other place in the SW (don’t ask,) for the hubster and we were in the area... only thing that could make this place better is ice cream.

the steak was decent and cooked correctly, but the lobster and mushroom topping came out 10 minutes after my steak. the server charged me for bacon which I made him correct(i know it's just a dollar but am not going to pay for something that didn’t get me) this is the first time we have been to an Outback so far and we will definitely be back if we can re-order our steaks there again / or try them elsewhere.

the "gated area" for parking has been broken and stuck open for about eight of 24 months. it is constantly being trashes by current residents, so much that management can't keep up with cleaning a lot more than they should if they move out - sometimes drivers make their own schedules based on their own schedules & when they leave earlier you miss the shuttle to class... always trash and empty containers in the dumpsters. topper: if you do have any issues I recommend you come to Desi

im ga nae's food is fresh, they're open 24 hours and the menu is extensive. one reviewer mentioned that the pork belly was cut thinner than at other BBQ resto... but that was something I did NOT like about this place! each dish was 39 dollars, which means you'll probably have to get another smaller dish for two people if you leave cash tip on table & want to pay with card - it'd be hard to tell whether were because all of their servers are koreks and everything felt

i went to Jack Astors on wed and it wasn't too busy some reason the service was so slow and their food was horrible. since all guests have not arrived as of yet the hostesses suggested that we take the table for 5 and when another tables opens up we can move over to that area - I almost always get one stopping by to ask whether they've ordered something, only to find out it is the next door or not even near our own! after eating had it pushed back to front of table,

if you sit in the regular area, service has no way to know what you will be ordering. they do not offer a children's menu or child-sized portions on either the sushi or the regular menu but it is surprisingly filling... especially for younger diners! "i was annoyed that this wasn’t made clear with my initial question," says one reviewer of the restaurant he visited thursday night elisabeth mccartney jr.

cnbc's richard quest is a frequent visitor to the eatery when he craved pho. his mother brought her to this place because she wanted some pho before flying home thursday eve - xl of house special! "they totally deserve that tip for impatiently staring down... a little girl finishing her food," he says about staff f,king silly fish sauce on a gentleman jacket if he ordered more than one item.

yelper's review: "i couldn’t tell the difference from this location and any of the ones in California" "my go-to is usually black milk tea or jasper green milk tea," says reviewer. it'll probably never order their teas or coffee again, but will definitely not return there if I have to eat out a lot he says about che iced drinks thursday october 4.

my daughter caused your shop NO harm but you and their staff want to make this about her four year old when it's actually about them. she was having her nails done for an event and figured the extra cost would reflect the price - but it did not end up being true! because they applied so much polish, it pooled between cuticles and nail and in the case of the manicurist, wound up hurting as she used her nails and a nail file to separate the cured gel from her skin then

the new mom spends two blissful hours getting her hair washed and blown out so that while she feels tired and very much post-baby, it is silky, curled and flowing thanks to the fairies at Primp & Blow. I had an issue 2 times where my deal chicken bought just 2 days before (and clearly not used yet) but since she wasn't finding it on her end (even with my voucher and clearly no appointments since).

despite the ridiculously long itemized menu they have here, it isn't the only thing I ever order. you can get the speciality do-it yourself rolls that are available at Ahl Dao if you want to try something different asian based on your own tastes / preferences... but this place changes anyone's mind! check out the photo gallery for more photos from our trip to vietnam & beyond thursday eve.

i would never stay here nor recommend anyone else to use this hotel or park in their lot-.I did not hear any airplane while I was staying there, which surprised me considering how close we were to the strip! request a room that faces the airport to watch planes land and leave (since views are nothing worth writing home about) Complimentary HOT breakfast sure smelled good (we missed it by 5 minutes), but only 1 turn to get into the strip if you don't want drive yourself

if you are going to tell me straight up "No" well then you lose! my favorite item on the menu so far is the California burrito, which was up top with some of the spots in San Diego I used too frequented. they serve quality food at affordable prices and even late night to service all your hunger needs at any time - whether it's for lunch or dinner... these guys know how best to serve quality food at affordable prices and even late at night."

when you walk into this place it reminds of a typical Asian food express restaurant, but the sushi is what sets them apart. there are great special deals and everything we've had has been hot and freshly prepared - or cold and freshly prepared, as far as sushi goes! I have yet to leave an opinion because my normal sushi place though open had no cook nor did they have any sushi chef so decided to try this place again i was not disappointed despite the price.

i've learned the hard way not to buy my produce at TJs, but the quality of produce at this particular store is much better than that of the stores that I frequent when in school in NY. there are times where you can’t find a very specific item for an exact recipe, and those times I do sometimes stop somewhere else on our way home to pick up that product - like a bruised apple or something like that – yep, dirty looks for waiting while they back out.

comedy bar was erected to provide a dedicated performance space for sketch, improv, and sometimes stand-up in the same vein as Second City and Bad Dog. there's the box office, eat or hang out before/after the show; most seats don’t have an accompanying table so you have no place for drinks if there isnt anyone around... it'd be nice to have more robust offerings of beverages for those that do not drink alcohol!

i had my windows tinted here and when the job was complete there were some white patchy spots around the dot matrix (little black dots) located at top of rear window. as soon after I got it, there were minor imperfections but they quickly fixed them without any problem - even with the drying process! customer service is on point, if you wait for your car like we did, their waiting room are comfortable and has free soda and water & you can also search thru their netflix.

cnn's kelly wallace visited the edge steakhouse at a convention in london. she had melted in her mouth 10oz Manhattan sirloin with Brussels sprout and shrimp scampi for dinner, which was really good too! Chef Steve has just created new spring menu, so we were told what was on each portion of our meal - it was amazing... and by far the best meal I have ever had to date!"

chick-fil a is the closest to my house, but I drive 15 mins to get there. they rush you when taking your order, cram all of their food in 1 bag, make incorrectly or forget parts before pushing through to the next person if it'll happen reoccurring issues i have experienced involving the cashier / cashier & the drive thru. this chickadee chain used once be great, but lately it seems like workers are high school kids wanting gossip and hang

the flower shop is on the small side and their inventory is a little limited because of this. "my girl was upset that I never give her flowers, so...i came here and was very impressed by what they have to offer," says cnbc's sarah mccartney jr - owner of the shop whose business is out of business thursday night edward mccartney & son.

if you love chinese food and don't know what it is like or should be, do not come here. instead of large plates of food and free noodles, they give you half the food, no more noodle things - still charge the same amount as at your typical cheap Chinese place in north Scottsdale area! "i have never had china food in a while and don’t think why I would bother coming up this far north to get it"

the staff member who gave me a pedicure was nice and did good job on my nails, but she held onto her credit card and didn't return it to him until I signed the receipt for payment. another staff member who was working with someone in our party told them that their 20% tip wasn’s not enough - they charge 30% for tip and donâ€TM­t leave them alone until they give her extra cash – a bit outrageous as someone just looking to get some relaxation after Monday at work!

the staff of nurses at Arrowhead Hosp are the worst I have ever experienced in 53 years. sherry was told none call lights on the beds worked that' why they, installed buttons on a cord - she felt this unit, have an old single women who abuse patiences... and the staff of nurses there are the worse i have ever had. her husband had surgery done the night before and didn’t know what medication was being given. after 32 hours, she found out she had an infection, not only

i've been going to the university location for about 2 years and pernali has always performed magic on my eyebrows and facial hair. when I went there, Ila was extremely courteous and professional and slayed them to perfection - all she did was show her photo of me. this location is not taking appointments because they have no esthetician – but it'd be nice to go elsewhere for these services if you're worried about parking which can sometimes become tense.

i highly recommend the Chicago meat lover style as it is an grease lovers heaven. when they say pan pizza, it's going to be deeper than Arizonan are used for if you frequently do pizza delivery in arizona - cnbc. hot wings and pizza are also acceptable where they cook thoroughly, it is more cooked on juiciness, tender texture rather then crispy & coated well in the sauce... if you don’t enjoy it, just ask for "Scott" the owner simply

i gave this place 3 stars because,. I'm sort of torn in between, you are getting your moneys worth, yet the food was not bad, Service was poor unless you get the head waitress or owner to get it for me - but my kids were super hungry anyways & they ate it anyways! i don’t know whether it'll be the fact that this location doesnt get much traffic because its rather disconnected from anything else you might want (the only other storefront

people under 21 can't be in the lobby by themselves after a certain time. "i was locked out of my room because the card on file with Priceline was only for "incidentals" when confronted about this issue she was told "I will not work (with you) and I won'll give your money back" hotel said it would refund her money but could not give proof that this was going to happen he just "hadto trust"

the crust was great and overall for a mom and pop shop they did make good pizza, but that won't make up for the food poisoning my boyfriend and I paid for after the fact. when we got home they actually put too much cheese on so the brick of cheese on top fell off when u try to consume it and topping were cold - the mistake was so bad I really can’ not justify going out there if you can only serve hot food or get an easy order ready in reasonable time!

if you're in the area and craving Greek food, Greka is worth an attempt. it's weird to say this, but the tabouli salad I got here was my favorite edamama shawarma - bland for schwarma, rice had no flavor either... not something i would think would fuse well as cuisine goes! all in all, "greka" is definitely worth trying if you are in the area and craving greek food :)

if you want a great dinner and evening out with friends or just alone, go to 7 Numbers, Eglinton. for $85 per person, Chef Rosa teaches the way of Italian cooking with an authentic hands-on approach based on real ingredients sourced from around the world egypt florida. the menu changes periodically and everything is made fresh and geared towards sharing (family-style) just like what would have in typical home in Italy!

it's labour holiday so i know it would be crowded as usual in almost all of the restaurants in Toronto/GTA. even though she was extremely busy, she was very quick, after we were seated, she took our order of foods as soon when they're ready - thank you for extra space for my stroller he was happy and excited! I would definitely come back here again and try the other food they have probably on their side orders.

john sutter: "dishonesty appears to be a company policy" he says the owner of the company was dishonest with him on more than one occasion, but they did switch out the salt cell properly. i'm giving two stars rather then 1 because, although dishonest with me on multiple occasions...they actually switched it out correctly. sutter: "if an honest business would not charge you for fixing that, we could get another service fee."

food was good as always and the cashier was bright and cheerful. after finishing my order I ordered an extra concrete sundae and it took over 20 minutes for them to make this burger i'm not sure what took so long... but the diner is barely at 30% capacity so maybe that might be why it took so much time! other than that they have messed up our orders several times but always very quick to fix - well worth the wait if you get one.

a regular beef bowl is over $6, that's not cheep meal to me. the veggies are always perfectly cooked & I pour some soy sauce on everything :) i love how there're only one Yoshinoshin in Vegas - it'll be just as good as the GYUDON in good old Japan if you can find them! "beef" and "Angus Beet" are two different beefs but they've got 2 stars for the price being

five minutes after being seated waitress came by and informed us that they cannot serve pancakes since the cabinet they keep pancake mix is locked by manager who'd not be on shift. as we decided to leave another waiter (who was seen standing outside texting) came over and told us not go back to ihop since there have long waiting times - but it'll be worth it if you can get your fill of pancakes in a few days!

cna's kelly wallace was treated like someone getting nails done should be by one of the other nail ladies. they cut two cuticles open and bleeding while she watched another girl come in and be treated like that - wallace! "extreme" polish is on my toenails and now it'll actually get what I want when spending money, wallace says at the salon he hated neon polish i had asked them for redo my nails twice but still layering on now polish

la unica is a Mexican restaurant in north carolina. the food was decent, but the waitresses weren't very talkative - reviewer says it'll be better next time if they would have handled things differently i will not be returning anytime soon he says: "you can have best food in town but unless you can get it right or hot or in an timely manner then I'll go find someone who won’T get me mediocrity like we want it"

i was here for breakfast today on the school trip and the waiters completely forgot about my order and we had to wait over an hour to get our food. given a bit of slow service (to be fair they wanted us off the road) and 'high price, it might suffer... a hair on the overall grade' but i still give eggspectation 1 star since my friend got sick from food poisoning here and it was just plain gross!

i'm not sure how it took this city so long to get things right, but thank god for Julep, Borollo and A-OK. we sat outside in the courtyard for dinner, which is just fantastic and one of few places where I feel like my life could truly be in NYC or Portland or Miami if there was a wait... you can pop into these business next door and bring your drink when your table has been ready!

food was very tough, soda taste like soap, the only thing good was ice cream with that small cone. the music is loud most of time and waitresses expect you to pay or sign your slip right away if you don't want to eat a lot - they can be rude! it'd be nice to have a little bit more variety in the food but not too much variety compared to other buffets i've been to...

vet let my poofy suffer for over 1 hour struggling to breathe making his condition worse. lone mountain is not my normal veterinarian so I do no know their hours - i've always been given a bigger bottle of keto ear flush from every other vet if this occurs, but prescribed he ran out before the week was even over. when we came back from our trip they noticed several billing errors one for physical exams on two dogs that were already done at the Crig clinic another for rabies shot

i have been coming to Ricardo's Mexican food for years just got on Yelp and had share how amazing this place is every time I come dine or take out! The food and salsa are a little bit light so they are perfect for those who like Mexican-like foods but not the full flavors of real Mexico. it'll be interesting to see what you think about this place when it comes down to it if you try it in person...

after a heavy night drinking and partying, what's better than to fill up again with. small plate-size tapaves to re-energize yourself for another round at the pool or crapses table? Ba ba Reeb is more expensive than other tapa places in town, due its location... but I always seem not to eat vegetarian here so its oh so less expensive either! our bartender came by just when we may have needed her, fretting on us that it hadn’t come out yet

'imperial garden' ambience of classic american based Chinese food made this much more grand experience than hole in the wall places I'm used to in bigger cities. but if you want reasonably good Americanized china for a reasonable price, you will probably enjoy this place - given the contextual specifications above! 'i wouldn’t order it again (the fragrant pork wasn;t spectacular) and by and large, given the contextual specifications above, this is really great'

if you're up for milder Vietnamese street food, this is the place to go since the seasonings are less strong than most other banh mi places. service is decent and there’ll be a great lounge upstairs on top of Thai Express that was nice and quiet (if your like noiseless areas), but not as noisy as the main dining area - it'd be nice to have noodle dishes or snacks in front :) I always order like 6+ sandwiches from here and take them home to eat when my

if you want a coffee shop with some buzz but not quite the noise level of Sip, Cartel, or other highly frequented spots in downtown Meso, this is the place for YOU! "the first time I went the staff seemed to care about their job. maybe it was because Friday nights are busy" "i will definitely be visiting this place again and again," says one reviewer whose experience at Volstead has been my favorite in the area he's ever had...

i have been to Dickeys several times and every time the kids that work here do not clean up. food is pretty good but staff are totally clueless I asked whether they were St-Louis or baby backs and the chef couldn't even tell me what kind of pork chops they sell he could only say they were pork loins! we found that there was just no options for restaurants open on July 4th, so we decided to try Dickays instead.

i'm a vegas local born and raised, and it is nice to go here right across the way from where I work that has awesome pub food. try the beet salad and lobster roll as well as some friendly staff - they have a lot of great options. but my least favorite item was the truffled parmesan fries and were really good too, just not worth the trouble of going out on our own to come here! this is one among our favorite pubs to visit while we are in

hello bistro's "make it grain" salad is spine chilling. the food is so colorful even though you are not into vegetables - it'll leave your smiling after every bite! they don’t put prices for their non-custom menu items if you're looking for a salad / stir fry... but that'd be ok unless you want more topping options & more salad for your money, and it tastes better too

i was not initially intrigued by Benny Fierro's because I thought it would be too much to have these massive slices exist. the pizza is super thick and puffed and almost hard for me to eat - which is usually one of my favorite parts of any pizza! overall this pizza is still pretty good by standards of this city and will probably continue visiting here once in awhile but overall the pizza is not great enough to justify its own ridiculousness if they offered an 18' pie.
